Description:
SNC Lavalin's Atkins business is one of the largest multidisciplinary, multi sector engineering design consultancies in the world and is part of the SNC Lavalin Group.As one of the world’s most respected design, engineering and project management consultancies with a leading track record in the defence sector, Atkins are ideally placed to respond to this market. We have a broad establishment and proud, 50 year history throughout the Middle East region.We provide a full range of design, engineering and project management services for buildings, transportation and other infrastructure programmes.Acquired by SNC Lavalin in 2017, we also have an extensive depth of geographic exposure across 50 countries and breadth of 53,000 experts. As one of the largest engineering consultants, we have access to 17,000 staff in the Middle East making us one of the largest multidisciplinary consultancies in the regionJob Title: Structural EngineerJob Description:As a Structural Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, analyzing, and ensuring the integrity and safety of various structures. You will work closely with architects, contractors, and other professionals to develop innovative structural designs and provide technical expertise throughout the project lifecycle. Your knowledge of structural engineering principles and your ability to apply them will be crucial in delivering high-quality and efficient solutions.Responsibilities:Design and Analysis: Develop structural designs for a wide range of projects, including buildings, bridges, industrial facilities, and infrastructure. Use computer-aided design (CAD) software and structural analysis tools to create models, perform calculations, and assess the structural integrity of the designs.Code Compliance: Ensure compliance with relevant building codes, regulations, and industry standards in all structural designs. Stay updated with the latest codes and incorporate them into design practices.Collaboration: Collaborate with architects, contractors, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements, constraints, and objectives. Work closely with interdisciplinary teams to integrate structural designs with architectural, mechanical, and electrical systems.Structural Analysis: Conduct structural analysis using software tools and manual calculations to determine the load capacities, stress distributions, and performance of structures under various conditions. Assess and mitigate potential risks and structural vulnerabilities.Technical Documentation: Prepare detailed technical reports, specifications, and drawings. Document design decisions, assumptions, and calculations. Review and approve drawings prepared by drafters and junior engineers.
Construction Support: Provide technical support during the construction phase of projects. Clarify design intent, respond to contractor queries, and review submittals to ensure compliance with design specifications.
Quality Assurance: Perform quality checks on design deliverables to ensure accuracy, completeness, and adherence to project requirements. Participate in design reviews and constructability assessments.
Continuous Learning: Stay updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, and advancements in structural engineering. Seek professional development opportunities to enhance skills and knowledge.Requirements:Bachelor's or Master's degree in Civil Engineering or a related field with a focus on structural engineering.

Proficiency in structural analysis software, such as SAP2000, ETABS, or similar tools.

Strong understanding of structural engineering principles, codes, and standards.

Familiarity with CAD software for drafting and modeling (e.g., AutoCAD, Revit).

Effective communication skills to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders.

Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Experience with structural design and analysis in projects of varying complexity (experience level may vary based on the specific position).

Knowledge of construction processes and materials.

Professional Engineer (PE) licensure or the ability to obtain licensure is preferred.

9+ years of experience.

Supervision experience a must.

GCC building supervision experience.Duties and ResponsibilitiesReviews and approves all contractor structural/civil technical submittals & sub-contractors

Leads and guides inspection teams on site

Replies to RFIs and coordination with other discipline and design teams

Follow-up with site observations and non-compliances

Reviews and deals with design calculations, analysis models and BIM models

Works independently and as part of a team to complete specific supervision activities assigned.

Responsible for providing approvals for the contractor’s structural technical submittals.

Collaborates/communicates with other disciplines regarding coordination issues and day-to-day supervision activities

Supports inspection team to resolve any site activity issues

Adopts creative and innovative solutions to site problems/clashes and develops appropriate supportive technical documentation/research reports

Coordinates with design team regarding specialist’s packages approvals by authorities

Informing and discussing design change decisions with colleagues to ensure project requirements are met

Reviews contractor variation orders in regarding structural/civil activities

Ensure that the structural design and construction adhere to safety regulations and guidelines.

Identify potential safety hazards and implement corrective measures to mitigate risks.Qualities and Skills requiredBuilding structural supervision experience

Experience and knowledge with using international Codes and standards.

Experience on structural supervision projects

Excellent presentation and communication abilities

Experience in using structure software such as AutoCAD,SAP ETABS, SAFE, STAAD, RAM .

Basic knowledge of BIM and REVIT platform

Knowledge of local authorities’ requirementsNote: The above job description provides a general overview of the typical duties and responsibilities of a Structural Engineer.
